Samples collected by the mobile Virology laboratory team of the National Public health Research Institute and tested on 21 October 2024 by RT-PCR returned positive for RVF. Samples tested on 23 October 2024 by RT-PCR at the Center for Medical Research and Health (CERMES) of Niamey returned positive for dengue. Blood samples collected and tested by RT-PCR on 14 October 2024 at the Center for Medical Research and Health (CERMES) of Niamey returned positive for Rift Valley fever. Several deaths and abortions have also been reported in the same farmer's livestock (especially among goats and camelids). Investigations are ongoing.

DESCRIPTION: Since 2015, the security situation in the Sahel and Eastern Burkina Faso has gradually deteriorated due to attacks by armed groups. Access to healthcare services remains a major challenge for the affected population. As of October 2024, 6.3 million people needed humanitarian assistance, 3.4 million of which are children and over 2.1 million IDPs registered, and 5 478 schools closed since the end of March 2024. A total of 17 883 people, including 16 627 children (with 9 238 girls and 7 389 boys), received community-based psychosocial support services. DESCRIPTION: Burundi continues to bear the brunt of climate-change-related natural disasters.
